briefdescription.para: Called when packets are sent from the voice buffer. The voice buffer contains packets that are already encoded with Opus and encrypted with Sodium, and merged into packets by the repacketizer, which is done in the dpp::discord_voice_client::send_audio method. You should use the buffer size properties of dpp::voice_buffer_send_t to determine if you should fill the buffer with more content.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string &token, uint32_t intents=i_default_intents, uint32_t shards=0, uint32_t cluster_id=0, uint32_t maxclusters=1, bool compressed=true, cache_policy_t policy={cp_aggressive, cp_aggressive, cp_aggressive}, uint32_t request_threads=12, uint32_t request_threads_raw=1)
memberdef.name: cluster

briefdescription.para: Constructor for creating a cluster. All but the token are optional.

parameterdescription.para: The bot token to use for all HTTP commands and websocket connections
A bitmask of dpd::intents values for all shards on this cluster. This is required to be sent for all bots with over 100 servers.

The total number of shards on this bot. If there are multiple clusters, then (shards / clusters) actual shards will run on this cluster. If you omit this value, the library will attempt to query the Discord API for the correct number of shards to start.
The ID of this cluster, should be between 0 and MAXCLUSTERS-1
The total number of clusters that are active, which may be on separate processes or even separate machines.
Whether or not to use compression for shards on this cluster. Saves a ton of bandwidth at the cost of some CPU
Set the user caching policy for the cluster, either lazy (only cache users/members when they message the bot) or aggressive (request whole member lists on seeing new guilds too)
The number of threads to allocate for making HTTP requests to Discord. This defaults to 12. You can increase this at runtime via the object returned from get_rest().
The number of threads to allocate for making HTTP requests to sites outside of Discord. This defaults to 1. You can increase this at runtime via the object returned from get_raw_rest().
Thrown on windows, if WinSock fails to initialise, or on any other system if a dpp::request_queue fails to construct

briefdescription.para: dpp::cluster is non-copyable
dpp::cluster is non-moveable
Destroy the cluster object.
Get the rest_queue object which handles HTTPS requests to Discord.

simplesect.para: request_queue* pointer to request_queue object

briefdescription.para: Get the raw rest_queue object which handles all HTTP(S) requests that are not directed at Discord.

simplesect.para: request_queue* pointer to request_queue object

briefdescription.para: Set the websocket protocol for all shards on this cluster. You should call this method before cluster::start. Generally ws_etf is faster, but provides less facilities for debugging should something go wrong. It is recommended to use ETF in production and JSON in development.

parameterdescription.para: websocket protocol to use, either ws_json or ws_etf.

simplesect.para: cluster& Reference to self for chaining.

briefdescription.para: Set the audit log reason for the next REST call to be made. This is set per-thread, so you must ensure that if you call this method, your request that is associated with the reason happens on the same thread where you set the reason. Once the next call is made, the audit log reason is cleared for this thread automatically.

detaileddescription.para: Example: bot.set_audit_reason("Toomuchabusivecontent") .channel_delete(my_channel_id);

parameterdescription.para: The reason to set for the next REST call on this thread

simplesect.para: cluster& Reference to self for chaining.

briefdescription.para: Clear the audit log reason for the next REST call to be made. This is set per-thread, so you must ensure that if you call this method, your request that is associated with the reason happens on the same thread where you set the reason. Once the next call is made, the audit log reason is cleared for this thread automatically.

simplesect.para: cluster& Reference to self for chaining.

briefdescription.para: Get the audit reason set for the next REST call to be made on this thread. This is set per-thread, so you must ensure that if you call this method, your request that is associated with the reason happens on the same thread where you set the reason. Once the next call is made, the audit log reason is cleared for this thread automatically.

simplesect.para: This method call clears the audit reason when it returns it.
std::string The audit reason to be used.

briefdescription.para: Log a message to whatever log the user is using. The logged message is passed up the chain to the on_log event in user code which can then do whatever it wants to do with it.

parameterdescription.para: The log level from dpp::loglevel
The log message to output

briefdescription.para: Start a timer. Every frequency seconds, the callback is called.

parameterdescription.para: The callback lambda to call for this timer when ticked
The callback lambda to call for this timer when it is stopped
How often to tick the timer in seconds

simplesect.para: timer A handle to the timer, used to remove that timer later

briefdescription.para: Stop a ticking timer.

parameterdescription.para: Timer handle received from cluster::start_timer

simplesect.para: bool True if the timer was stopped, false if it did not exist
If the timer has an on_stop lambda, the on_stop lambda will be called.

briefdescription.para: Get the dm channel for a user id.

briefdescription.para: Add guild member. Needs a specific oauth2 scope, from which you get the access_token.

detaileddescription.para: Adds a user to the guild, provided you have a valid oauth2 access token for the user with the guilds.join scope. Returns the guild_member, which is defaulted if the user is already a member of the guild. Fires a Guild Member Add Gateway event.

For guilds with Membership Screening enabled, this endpoint will default to adding new members as pending in the guild member object. Members that are pending will have to complete membership screening before they become full members that can talk.

simplesect.para: All parameters to this endpoint except for access_token are optional. The bot must be a member of the guild with CREATE_INSTANT_INVITE permission.

parameterdescription.para: Guild member to add
Access token from Oauth2 scope

Function to call when the API call completes. On success the callback will contain a dpp::guild_member object in confirmation_callback_t::value. On failure, the value is undefined and confirmation_callback_t::is_error() method will return true. You can obtain full error details with confirmation_callback_t::get_error().

briefdescription.para: Edit the properties of an existing guild member.

detaileddescription.para:
Modify attributes of a guild member. Returns the guild_member. Fires a Guild Member Update Gateway event. If the channel_id is set to 0, this will force the target user to be disconnected from voice. To remove a timeout, set the communication_disabled_until to a non-zero time in the past, e.g. 1. When moving members to channels, the API user must have permissions to both connect to the channel and have the MOVE_MEMBERS permission.
https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/guild#modify-guild-member
This method supports audit log reasons set by the cluster::set_audit_reason() method.
gm
Guild member to edit
callback
Function to call when the API call completes. On success the callback will contain a dpp::guild_member object in confirmation_callback_t::value. detaileddescription.para: Create a new guild. Returns a guild object on success. Fires a Guild Create Gateway event.

When using the roles parameter, the first member of the array is used to change properties of the guild's everyone role. If you are trying to bootstrap a guild with additional roles, keep this in mind. The required id field within each role object is an integer placeholder, and will be replaced by the API upon consumption. Its purpose is to allow you to overwrite a role's permissions in a channel when also passing in channels with the channels array. When using the channels parameter, the position field is ignored, and none of the default channels are created. The id field within each channel object may be set to an integer placeholder, and will be replaced by the API upon consumption. Its purpose is to allow you to create GUILD_CATEGORY channels by setting the parent_id field on any children to the category's id field. Category channels must be listed before any children.

simplesect.para: The region field is deprecated and is replaced by channel.rtc_region. This endpoint can be used only by bots in less than 10 guilds.

parameterdescription.para: Guild to create

Function to call when the API call completes. On success the callback will contain a dpp::guild object in confirmation_callback_t::value. On failure, the value is undefined and confirmation_callback_t::is_error() method will return true. You can obtain full error details with confirmation_callback_t::get_error().

detaileddescription.para: Begin a prune operation. Requires the KICK_MEMBERS permission. Returns a prune object indicating the number of members that were removed in the prune operation. For large guilds it's recommended to set the compute_prune_count option to false, forcing 'pruned' to 0. Fires multiple Guild Member Remove Gateway events. By default, prune will not remove users with roles. You can optionally include specific roles in your prune by providing the include_roles parameter. detaileddescription.para: When the content field is edited, the mentions array in the message object will be reconstructed from scratch based on the new content. The allowed_mentions field of the edit request controls how this happens. If there is no explicit allowed_mentions in the edit request, the content will be parsed with default allowances, that is, without regard to whether or not an allowed_mentions was present in the request that originally created the message.

simplesect.para: the attachments array must contain all attachments that should be present after edit, including retained and new attachments provided in the request body.

memberdef.name: current_user_set_voice_state

briefdescription.para: Set the bot's voice state on a stage channel.

detaileddescription.para: There are currently several caveats for this endpoint:

listitem.para: channel_id must currently point to a stage channel.
current user must already have joined channel_id.
You must have the MUTE_MEMBERS permission to unsuppress yourself. You can always suppress yourself.
You must have the REQUEST_TO_SPEAK permission to request to speak. You can always clear your own request to speak.
You are able to set request_to_speak_timestamp to any present or future time.

parameterdescription.para: Guild to set voice state on
Stage channel to set voice state on
Function to call when the API call completes.
True if the user's audio should be suppressed, false if it should not

The time at which we requested to speak, or 0 to clear the request. The time set here must be the current time or in the future. On success the callback will contain a dpp::scheduled_event object in confirmation_callback_t::value. On failure, the value is undefined and confirmation_callback_t::is_error() method will return true. You can obtain full error details with confirmation_callback_t::get_error().
You attempted to set a request_to_speak_timestamp in the past which is not the value of 0.

memberdef.argsstring: (snowflake user_id, snowflake guild_id, snowflake channel_id, bool suppress=false, command_completion_event_t callback=utility::log_error())
memberdef.name: user_set_voice_state

briefdescription.para: Set a user's voice state on a stage channel.

detaileddescription.para: There are currently several caveats for this endpoint:

listitem.para: channel_id must currently point to a stage channel.
User must already have joined channel_id.
You must have the MUTE_MEMBERS permission. (Since suppression is the only thing that is available currently)
When unsuppressed, non-bot users will have their request_to_speak_timestamp set to the current time. Bot users will not.
When suppressed, the user will have their request_to_speak_timestamp removed.

parameterdescription.para: The user to set the voice state of
Guild to set voice state on
Stage channel to set voice state on
Function to call when the API call completes.

True if the user's audio should be suppressed, false if it should not On success the callback will contain a dpp::scheduled_event object in confirmation_callback_t::value. On failure, the value is undefined and confirmation_callback_t::is_error() method will return true. You can obtain full error details with confirmation_callback_t::get_error().

briefdescription.para: Create a guild.

detaileddescription.para: Create a new guild. Returns a guild object on success. Fires a Guild Create Gateway event.

When using the roles parameter, the first member of the array is used to change properties of the guild's everyone role. If you are trying to bootstrap a guild with additional roles, keep this in mind. The required id field within each role object is an integer placeholder, and will be replaced by the API upon consumption. Its purpose is to allow you to overwrite a role's permissions in a channel when also passing in channels with the channels array. When using the channels parameter, the position field is ignored, and none of the default channels are created. The id field within each channel object may be set to an integer placeholder, and will be replaced by the API upon consumption. Its purpose is to allow you to create GUILD_CATEGORY channels by setting the parent_id field on any children to the category's id field. Category channels must be listed before any children.

simplesect.para: The region field is deprecated and is replaced by channel.rtc_region. This endpoint can be used only by bots in less than 10 guilds.

parameterdescription.para: Guild to create

simplesect.para: guild returned object on completion

briefdescription.para: Get guild ban list.

detaileddescription.para:
Requires the BAN_MEMBERS permission.
dpp::cluster::guild_get_bans
https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/guild#get-guild-bans
Provide a user ID to before and after for pagination. Users will always be returned in ascending order by the user ID. If both before and after are provided, only before is respected.
guild_id
Guild ID to get bans for
before
If non-zero, all bans for user ids before this user id will be returned up to the limit
after
if non-zero, all bans for user ids after this user id will be returned up to the limit
limit
the maximum number of bans to retrieve in this call up to a maximum of 1000

briefdescription.para: Begin guild prune.

detaileddescription.para: Begin a prune operation. Requires the KICK_MEMBERS permission. Returns a prune object indicating the number of members that were removed in the prune operation. For large guilds it's recommended to set the compute_prune_count option to false, forcing 'pruned' to 0. Fires multiple Guild Member Remove Gateway events. By default, prune will not remove users with roles. You can optionally include specific roles in your prune by providing the include_roles parameter. Any inactive user that has a subset of the provided role(s) will be included in the prune and users with additional roles will not.

briefdescription.para: Add guild member. Needs a specific oauth2 scope, from which you get the access_token.

detaileddescription.para: Adds a user to the guild, provided you have a valid oauth2 access token for the user with the guilds.join scope. Returns the guild_member, which is defaulted if the user is already a member of the guild. Fires a Guild Member Add Gateway event.

For guilds with Membership Screening enabled, this endpoint will default to adding new members as pending in the guild member object. Members that are pending will have to complete membership screening before they become full members that can talk.

simplesect.para: All parameters to this endpoint except for access_token are optional. The bot must be a member of the guild with CREATE_INSTANT_INVITE permission.

memberdef.name: current_user_set_voice_state_sync

briefdescription.para: Set the bot's voice state on a stage channel.

detaileddescription.para: There are currently several caveats for this endpoint:

listitem.para: channel_id must currently point to a stage channel.
current user must already have joined channel_id.
You must have the MUTE_MEMBERS permission to unsuppress yourself. You can always suppress yourself.
You must have the REQUEST_TO_SPEAK permission to request to speak. You can always clear your own request to speak.
You are able to set request_to_speak_timestamp to any present or future time.

parameterdescription.para: Guild to set voice state on
Stage channel to set voice state on

simplesect.para: confirmation returned object on completion

parameterdescription.para: True if the user's audio should be suppressed, false if it should not
The time at which we requested to speak, or 0 to clear the request. The time set here must be the current time or in the future.
You attempted to set a request_to_speak_timestamp in the past which is not the value of 0.
upon failure to execute REST function

simplesect.para: This function is a blocking (synchronous) call and should only be used from within a separate thread. Avoid direct use of this function inside an event handler.

memberdef.argsstring: (snowflake user_id, snowflake guild_id, snowflake channel_id, bool suppress=false)
memberdef.name: user_set_voice_state_sync

briefdescription.para: Set a user's voice state on a stage channel.

detaileddescription.para: There are currently several caveats for this endpoint:

listitem.para: channel_id must currently point to a stage channel.
User must already have joined channel_id.
You must have the MUTE_MEMBERS permission. (Since suppression is the only thing that is available currently)
When unsuppressed, non-bot users will have their request_to_speak_timestamp set to the current time. Bot users will not.
When suppressed, the user will have their request_to_speak_timestamp removed.

parameterdescription.para: The user to set the voice state of
Guild to set voice state on
Stage channel to set voice state on

memberdef.argsstring: (const class webhook &wh, const struct message &m, snowflake thread_id=0)
memberdef.name: edit_webhook_message_sync

briefdescription.para: Edit webhook message.

detaileddescription.para: When the content field is edited, the mentions array in the message object will be reconstructed from scratch based on the new content. The allowed_mentions field of the edit request controls how this happens. If there is no explicit allowed_mentions in the edit request, the content will be parsed with default allowances, that is, without regard to whether or not an allowed_mentions was present in the request that originally created the message.

simplesect.para: the attachments array must contain all attachments that should be present after edit, including retained and new attachments provided in the request body.

parameterdescription.para: Webhook to edit message for
New message
ID of the thread the message is in

simplesect.para: message returned object on completion

parameterdescription.para: upon failure to execute REST function

simplesect.para: This function is a blocking (synchronous) call and should only be used from within a separate thread. Avoid direct use of this function inside an event handler.

memberdef.name: execute_webhook_sync

briefdescription.para: Execute webhook.

parameterdescription.para: Webhook to execute
Message to send
waits for server confirmation of message send before response, and returns the created message body
Send a message to the specified thread within a webhook's channel. The thread will automatically be unarchived
Name of thread to create (requires the webhook channel to be a forum channel)

simplesect.para: message returned object on completion

If the webhook channel is a forum channel, you must provide either thread_id or thread_name. If thread_id is provided, the message will send in that thread. If thread_name is provided, a thread with that name will be created in the forum channel.

parameterdescription.para: upon failure to execute REST function

simplesect.para: This function is a blocking (synchronous) call and should only be used from within a separate thread. Avoid direct use of this function inside an event handler.

briefdescription.para: The cluster class represents a group of shards and a command queue for sending and receiving commands from discord via HTTP. You should usually instantiate a cluster object at the very least to make use of the library.
